meta.goal: Software Architect / Staff–Principal IC Interview Readiness — ASAP Switch Mode

career_context.current_state: Role stagnation at Cimpress (Pixartprinting). No IC architect ladder. Urgent switch required.
career_context.strategy: External switch with compressed timeline. Applications start Week 3. AWS cert runs in parallel, not as a gate.
constraints: AWS cert in parallel with job search
career_context.financial_state: Stable — no panic required, but no reason to delay

meta.preparation_philosophy: Real interviews > perfect preparation. Start applying by Week 3. Learn fastest inside live loops.

rules: Applications never stop — 2–3 per week minimum

adaptation_rules.no_applications_this_week: Treat as a missed session — apply next day minimum

avoid_roles: Vague architect titles with no IC ladder
Roles with no distributed systems or platform scope

topics.name: Rewrite LinkedIn headline and About section
topics.micro_task: Headline: 'Software Architect · Distributed Systems · NestJS · SaaS Platforms · AWS · Open to Opportunities'. About: open with 12-year narrative and what you're seeking next.

topics.name: Turn on Open to Work (recruiters only) on LinkedIn
topics.micro_task: Set target roles: Software Architect, Staff Engineer, Principal Engineer, Platform Architect. Location: Pune + Remote. Takes 2 minutes. Do it today.

topics.name: Quantify every resume bullet with numbers
topics.micro_task: For each role answer: team size, system scale (req/sec, users), % improvement. Example: 'Reduced onboarding time by ~60% for a team of 8 through unified NestJS monorepo'.

topics.name: Reach out to 10 former colleagues for referrals
topics.micro_task: Message Amla Commerce and Pixartprinting contacts. Ask for a 15-min catch-up, mention exploring opportunities. One referral bypasses screening entirely — worth 20 cold applications.

topics.name: Build target company list — 15–20 companies across 3 tiers
topics.micro_task: Tier 1: Razorpay, CRED, Swiggy, Zepto, remote EU/US. Tier 2: mid-size SaaS/e-commerce product companies. Tier 3: consulting/MNCs as backup. Apply Tier 2/3 first to build interview muscle.

topics.name: Publish one architecture README on GitHub
topics.micro_task: Pick Pixartprinting NestJS monorepo or Amla FabricJS engine. Write: problem, decisions, trade-offs, Excalidraw diagram (screenshot it). This is your public proof-of-work before interviews start.

topics.name: Start AWS Solutions Architect Associate — 1hr/day in parallel
topics.micro_task: Use Stephane Maarek Udemy course + AWS practice exams. 1hr/day from Week 1 = exam-ready by Week 7–8. Do NOT wait to finish before applying.

topics.name: Learn a repeatable system design framework
topics.micro_task: Structure every HLD answer: (1) Clarify + scope, (2) Estimate scale, (3) Define APIs, (4) High-level design, (5) Deep dive bottlenecks, (6) Trade-off discussion. Practice out loud. Time yourself to 40 minutes.

topics.name: Practice 8 system design problems — record yourself
topics.micro_task: Cover: URL shortener, distributed order system (use Pixartprinting experience), multi-tenant SaaS (use Amla background), API gateway + rate limiting, real-time notifications, CDN + caching, event-driven async pipeline, monorepo CI/CD. Record and listen back.

topics.name: Write 6 core STAR stories
topics.micro_task: Cover: (1) biggest architectural decision + impact, (2) disagreed with leadership, (3) handled failing migration, (4) mentored a junior engineer, (5) trade-off you'd make differently, (6) influenced team without authority. Write fully. Practice under 2 minutes each.

topics.name: Do 2–4 paid mock interviews — system design focus
topics.micro_task: Use Interviewing.io or senior LinkedIn contacts. External feedback reveals blind spots self-review cannot. Minimum 2 paid sessions. Highest ROI activity in this sprint.

topics.name: Keep applying — 2–3 companies per week without stopping
topics.micro_task: LinkedIn Easy Apply for Tier 2/3, direct referrals for Tier 1, Wellfound/Instahyre for startups, Naukri for corporates. Set a recurring Friday reminder. No week should pass without applications.

topics.name: Build AI fluency talking points for interviews
topics.micro_task: Prepare answers for: (1) designing a RAG-based search for e-commerce catalog, (2) LLM API cost governance at scale, (3) observability for non-deterministic AI systems. Watch Karpathy Intro to LLMs (1hr YouTube) first.

topics.name: Publish 1 LinkedIn post or short article
topics.micro_task: Topic: 'Why we migrated to a NestJS monorepo — and what I'd do differently.' ~400 words. Tags: #softwarearchitecture #nestjs #nodejs #distributedsystems. Creates recruiter inbound.

topics.name: Debrief every interview within 1 hour of finishing
topics.micro_task: Write: questions asked, how you answered, what felt weak. After 4–5 interviews you'll have a clear gap map. Fix those gaps specifically before your next loop.

topics.name: Clear AWS Solutions Architect Associate exam
topics.micro_task: Book exam slot at least 2 weeks in advance. Started Week 1 at 1hr/day = ready by Week 7–8. Cert lands on profile before final rounds at Tier 1 companies.

topics.name: Research compensation benchmarks before any offer call
topics.micro_task: Check Levels.fyi, LinkedIn Salary, Glassdoor. India product companies: Rs 30–60 LPA. Remote EU/US: $80k–$150k+. Know your number before the call — never during it. Always counter the first offer.

topics.name: Prepare 30-60-90 day plan answer
topics.micro_task: Day 1–30: listen, map systems, build team-lead relationships. Day 31–60: identify highest-leverage architectural gaps, propose one quick win. Day 61–90: present a roadmap. Specific and prepared beats winging it every time.

topics.name: Create competing offer leverage
topics.micro_task: Run 2+ active loops simultaneously. Even a less-preferred offer gives leverage: 'I have another offer at X — is there flexibility to match?' Works at every level.

topics.name: Apply to 3–5 international remote roles in parallel
topics.micro_task: Cimpress background = credibility with European employers. NestJS + distributed systems + multi-tenant SaaS is valued in EU/UK. Remote often pays 2–4x Indian rates. Use Turing, Toptal, LinkedIn outreach to EU product companies.

topics.name: Don't stop applying until contract is signed
topics.micro_task: A verbal offer is not an offer. Keep all loops running until ink is dry. Offers fall through — companies freeze headcount, managers change. Close loops gracefully only after signing.

topics.name: Plan notice period strategically
topics.micro_task: Negotiate buyout or 60–90 day start date with new employer upfront. Don't resign until offer is signed. Leave Cimpress cleanly — they are a reference.

topics.name: SOLID & OCP in production systems
topics.micro_task: Document 3 real SOLID/OCP violations you fixed

topics.name: Hexagonal / Clean Architecture
topics.micro_task: Draw ports & adapters for a real project

topics.name: Factory & Strategy patterns
topics.micro_task: Refactor if-else logic using Strategy + Factory

topics.name: Adapter & Decorator patterns
topics.micro_task: Design backward-compatible adapter for legacy API

topics.name: Async workflows, retries, idempotency
topics.micro_task: Design idempotent retry flow for payment API

topics.name: Schema design & backward-compatible migrations
topics.micro_task: Outline zero-downtime migration steps

topics.name: Machine coding (architect lens)
topics.micro_task: Design a service with extensibility & testability

topics.name: Explain a real system end-to-end
topics.micro_task: Explain architecture, boundaries, and evolution in 10–15 minutes

topics.name: Monorepo vs multi-repo trade-offs
topics.micro_task: Write ADR with 3 trade-offs and final decision

topics.name: Sync vs async communication
topics.micro_task: Explain scenarios where async hurts more than helps

topics.name: Failure handling & resilience
topics.micro_task: Design graceful degradation for partial failures

topics.name: Scalability & performance
topics.micro_task: Identify hot paths and caching strategy

topics.name: Observability (logs, metrics, traces)
topics.micro_task: Define SLIs/SLOs for a core service

topics.name: System evolution & migration patterns
topics.micro_task: Design strangler-fig migration plan

topics.name: HLD archetype: Payment system
topics.micro_task: Design payment flow with idempotency & ledger safety

topics.name: HLD archetype: Notification / real-time system
topics.micro_task: Design pub-sub based notification architecture

topics.name: LLM system architecture — RAG, embeddings, vector DBs
topics.micro_task: Design a RAG-based product search for an e-commerce catalog. Resource: Andrej Karpathy Intro to LLMs (YouTube, 1hr).

topics.name: AI governance — cost, observability, prompt injection risks
topics.micro_task: Define guardrails and cost controls for an LLM API integration at scale. Resource: AI Engineering by Chip Huyen.

topics.name: Agent orchestration patterns (LangGraph / MCP)
topics.micro_task: Map agent loop, tool use, and failure modes to distributed systems equivalents. Resource: LangChain / LangGraph docs — build one small agent project.

topics.name: AWS Solutions Architect Associate (primary — HIGH priority)
topics.micro_task: 1hr/day from Week 1 using Stephane Maarek Udemy course. Target exam by Week 7–8. Book slot 2 weeks in advance. Study in parallel with job search — not as a gate.

topics.name: TOGAF 9 Foundation (optional — only for enterprise/banking/consulting roles)
topics.micro_task: Skip for product company roles. Never expires once cleared. Evaluate only if Tier 1 targets include large enterprise or consulting firms.

topics.name: iSAQB CPSA-F (optional — relevant given Cimpress European background)
topics.micro_task: Well regarded in EU. Evaluate if actively applying to European remote roles. Could strengthen applications to EU product companies.

topics.name: Decision I reversed
topics.micro_task: Explain why original decision failed and what changed

topics.name: Trade-off defended under pressure
topics.micro_task: Explain cost vs scale vs complexity decision

topics.name: Failure that improved the system
topics.micro_task: Explain guardrails added after failure

HLD.expected_output: End-to-end system design explained in 10–15 minutes

application_readiness_gate.purpose: Signal when to start applying — in ASAP mode this gate is intentionally low
application_readiness_gate.rule: Apply when minimum gates are satisfied. Do NOT wait for full readiness.

LLD.completion_criteria: Can design and explain trade-offs without notes

BEHAVIORAL.completion_criteria: Can narrate calmly with learning focus

application_readiness_gate.recommendation_on_pass: Start applying immediately. Tier 2/3 companies first to build interview muscle. Tier 1 after 3–4 real loops.
application_readiness_gate.asap_override: Urgent mode — begin applications by Week 3 regardless of gate status. Real interviews compound faster than study sessions.

mock_interviews.note: Minimum 2 paid sessions. External feedback reveals blind spots self-review cannot.
